text: During the summer, when the heat increases the thirst, a lion and a wild boar came to drink from the same spring. They discussed who should drink first, and from the discussion they went on to a fierce fight to the death. But, at a moment's rest, they saw a cloud of birds of prey waiting for some defeated one to devour him. And they were reassured, and said, Let us be friends, and let us not eat the vultures and the ravens. Useless struggles only serve to enrich and nourish their viewers.
title: El león y el jabalí
author: nan Esopo
